data.title: When I see American soldiers in their ceremonial dress, why do they appear to have an unbelievable amount of ribbons?
data.meta_description:
Answer (1 of 9): What you see are the ribbons for medals the soldier earns by achievement and commendation for excellent performance, ribbons for service and for participation in campaigns, and medals awarded by foreign governments. Old conduct for 4 years earns a medal. They add up.
